msDesc.head: Nicholas de Gorran, Distinctiones theologicae. France, s. xiv1.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1427–1434. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Nicholas de Gorran
msItem.title: Distinctiones theologicae
msItem.note: (unpr.; Little 2, this copy; Thomson, Grosseteste, 248, no. 17, this copy; Stegmüller, RB, 5740, citing the present MS., & 7404,5; Hauréau, Initia, 1. 4vb–5ra, this copy at fol. 4vb; Bloomfield 62, citing the present MS., and suppl.; Kaeppeli 3090, this copy).
(fol. 167rb) four colophons, one below the other (Colophons 6. 21383, citing the present MS.; see also W. Wattenbach, Das Schriftwesen im Mittelalter (Leipzig, 31896) 510):
msItem.colophon: Explicit iste liber sit scriptor crimine liber
Explicit iste liber benedictus omnipotens rex
msItem.note: (fols 167va–168rg) Tabula. List of words in their order, with chapter numbers.
Addition (on paupertas) to the text on fol. 129va (item 1).

(fol. 170v) Note regarding payment to a professional scribe: ‘Nota quod post recessum domini Iohannis dedi scriptori istorum quaternorum .vj. solidos parisienses. de quibus dominus Iohannes reliquit michi xxxij. denarios adhuc remanent mihi .xl. denarii.’ The scribe of the book was paid with money which dominus Iohannes, possibly the commissioner of MS. Laud Misc. 555, had left after his death for this purpose.

supportDesc.support: parchment; medieval repairs (stitching, with plain thread) on fols 17, 31, 44, 64, 141 & 165. A bookmark made of brown-coloured thread horizontally sewn into the outer centre of fol. 167, marking the end of the Distinctiones and beginning of the tabula; damaged now.
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1–171, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil; (fols 1v–166v) Foliation in roman numerals in a hand of s. xivex, possibly from the Mainz Charterhouse.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in lead point; two columns of 43–45, mostly 44 lines (fols 168va–170vb, additional texts: 36–61 written lines, unruled). Ruled space c.181–202 130–38
Ruling for the tabula (fols 167va–168rh) laid out in 4 + 4 columns per page of 45 & 46 lines. Ruled space c.184-85 130-137

handDesc.handNote: French textualis, s. xiv1, mainly one hand. Occasional corrections and marginal annotations in the text hand and in younger hands of s. xiv–xv, one of which is responsible for the foliation and correction of the tabula; another one corrected the initial on fol. 70ra and sporadically added paraphs, in black ink, e.g. on fol. 62ra–rb: these hands may well be from the Mainz Charterhouse. Two additional hands of s. xivex, possibly from the Mainz Charterhouse, writing in textualis: 1) (fols 168va–170rb) item 2; 2) (fol. 170va–vb) item 3.

decoDesc.decoNote: Flourished initials in red and blue.
Coloured initials in red and blue.
Initials secondarily infilled, with acanthus motif, in Charterhouse ink.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

origin.origPlace: France: see also the note of payment at the head of fol. 170v, mentioning ‘solidos parisienses’ (discussed above, item 3).

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the upper left-hand margin of fol. 1r: ‘Iste liber est Cartusiensium prope mogunciam’. Identifiable as F XXI S in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 400 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 46

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1427–1434

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
